newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Metro Bank, two others to raise capital.
newsitem.headline: Metro Bank, two others to raise capital.

text.p: The Philippines' biggest bank, Metropolitan Bank and Trust Co, and two other financial institutions planned to increase their capital to fund their expansion, officials of the banks said.

Metrobank president Antonio Abacan said on Saturday the company planned to raise its capital to 40 billion pesos from the current 33 billion pesos, to maintain its lead in the domestic banking system and to bolster its offshore expansion, particularly in the Asian region.
Metrobank expects to achieve the increase within the first six months of the year, he told reporters.

Allied Bank president Federico Pascual said Allied planned to double its capital to 14 billion pesos over the next two years from the existing seven billion pesos. He cited growing competition as one reason the bank needed to expand.

Security Bank president Rafael Simpao said his bank planned to raise its capital to 10 billion pesos from the current 6.1 billion pesos. The increase was expected to be completed by next year, he said.
